name: Ammonia N 13

indications.text: ammonia n 13 injection , usp indicated diagnostic positron emission tomography ( pet ) imaging myocardium rest pharmacologic stress conditions evaluate myocardial perfusion patients suspected existing coronary artery disease .

contraindications.text: rest imaging study ( 2.1 ) : aseptically withdraw ammonia n 13 injection container administer 10 mci—20 mci ( 0.368 gbq—0.736 gbq ) bolus catheter inserted large peripheral vein . start imaging 3 minutes injection acquire images total 10-20 minute stress imaging study ( 2.2 ) : rest imaging study performed , begin stress imaging study 40 minutes first ammonia n 13 injection allow sufficient isotope decay . administer pharmacologic stress-inducing accordance labeling . aseptically withdraw ammonia n 13 injection container administer 10 mci—20 mci ( 0.368 gbq—0.736 gbq ) ammonia n 13 injection bolus 8 minutes pharmacologic stress-inducing . start imaging 3 minutes ammonia n 13 injection acquire images total 10-20 minutes . patient preparation ( 2.3 ) : increase renal clearance radioactivity minimize radiation dose bladder , hydrate patient procedure encourage voiding soon image acquisition completed often possible thereafter least one hour .

warningsAndPrecautions: ammonia n 13 injection , usp packaged 30 ml multiple dose glass vial containing 1.11 gbq 11.1 gbq ( 30 mci 300 mci ) [ 13n ] ammonia , end synthesis ( eos ) reference time , 0.9 % sodium chloride injection solution approximately 10 ml volume . recommended dose radioactivity ( 10 mci – 20 mci ) associated theoretical mass dose 0.5-1.0 picomoles ammonia . ndc 73410-001-01 storage store 25°c ( 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15-30°c ( 59-86°f ) . solution within 60 minutes end synthesis ( eos ) calibration .
indications_original: Ammonia N 13 Injection, USP is indicated for diagnostic Positron Emission Tomography (PET) imaging of the myocardium under rest or pharmacologic stress conditions to evaluate myocardial perfusion in patients with suspected or existing coronary artery disease.
contraindications_original: Rest Imaging Study ( 2.1 ): Aseptically withdraw Ammonia N 13 Injection from its container and administer 10 mCi—20 mCi (0.368 GBq—0.736 GBq) as a bolus through a catheter inserted into a large peripheral vein. Start imaging 3 minutes after the injection and acquire images for a total of 10-20 minute Stress Imaging Study ( 2.2 ): If a rest imaging study is performed, begin the stress imaging study 40 minutes or more after the first Ammonia N 13 injection to allow for sufficient isotope decay. Administer a pharmacologic stress-inducing drug in accordance with its labeling. Aseptically withdraw Ammonia N 13 Injection from its container and administer 10 mCi—20 mCi (0.368 GBq—0.736 GBq) of Ammonia N 13 Injection as a bolus at 8 minutes  after the administration of the pharmacologic stress-inducing drug. Start imaging 3 minutes after the Ammonia N 13 Injection and acquire images for a total of 10-20 minutes. Patient Preparation ( 2.3 ): To increase renal clearance of radioactivity and to minimize radiation dose to the bladder, hydrate the patient before the procedure and encourage voiding as soon as each image acquisition is completed and as often as possible thereafter for at least one hour.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Ammonia N 13 Injection, USP is packaged in 30 mL multiple dose glass vial containing between 1.11 GBq to 11.1 GBq (30 mCi to 300 mCi) of [13N] ammonia, at the end of synthesis (EOS) reference time, in 0.9% sodium chloride injection solution in approximately 10 mL volume. The recommended dose of radioactivity (10 mCi – 20 mCi) is associated with a theoretical mass dose of 0.5-1.0 picomoles of Ammonia.
                  NDC 73410-001-01
                  
                     Storage
                  
                  Store at 25°C (77°F); excursions permitted to 15-30°C (59-86°F). Use the solution within 60 minutes of the End of Synthesis (EOS) calibration.
